meanings.sent1: She liquefied the chocolate by heating it gently.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream liquefied quickly under the hot sun.
meanings.sent3: The magician liquefied the metal into a shiny puddle.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to liquefy her heart, melting away all doubts.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes seemed to liquefy on the canvas, creating a beautiful blend of colors.

meanings.definition: To convert into a liquid form.
meanings.sent1: The company liquefied its assets to pay off debts.
meanings.sent2: The heat from the fire liquefied the wax candles on the table.
meanings.sent3: The chef's special sauce was so good, it could liquefy any solid food it touched.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to liquefy the hardest of hearts.
meanings.sent5: The intense pressure and heat can liquefy rocks deep within the Earth's crust.
